title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #757** asks for the best constant c such that almost-Sidon sets must contain Sidon subsets of linear size.

An **almost-Sidon set** A has the property that every 4-element subset B satisfies |B - B| ≥ 11. For comparison, a true Sidon set of size 4 has |B - B| = 13.

**Known Bounds** (Gyárfás-Lehel 1995):
- 1/2 < c < 3/5

The exact value of c is OPEN.
mathContext: The condition |B - B| ≥ 11 means at most one 'collision' among differences—a minimal relaxation of the Sidon property.

title: Sidon Set Definition
content:
**IsSidon S** means: if a + b = c + d for elements in S, then {a, b} = {c, d}.

This captures the property that all pairwise sums are distinct. Equivalently, all non-zero differences are distinct.

Sidon sets are also called **B₂ sequences** in additive combinatorics.
mathContext: Named after Simon Sidon, who studied such sets in the context of Fourier analysis.

title: Almost-Sidon Property
content:
**AlmostSidon A** means: every 4-element subset B ⊆ A has |B - B| ≥ 11.

Since a 4-element Sidon set has |B - B| = 13 (0 plus 12 distinct ±differences), requiring ≥ 11 allows at most one collision among differences.

This is a 'local' condition—each 4-element subset is nearly Sidon.

title: Admissible Constants
content:
**IsAdmissible c** means: every finite almost-Sidon set A contains a Sidon subset S with |S| ≥ c|A|.

The problem asks for sup{c : IsAdmissible c}—the best guaranteed linear fraction of a Sidon subset.
mathContext: The supremum exists because c = 0 is admissible and c ≤ 1 (can't have more than 100%).

title: Main Conjecture (OPEN)
content:
**Erdős Problem #757**: Find the exact value of sSup {c | IsAdmissible c}.

The conjecture asserts this supremum exists in the interval (1/2, 3/5). The exact value is OPEN despite 30+ years of study.

Note: This is stated as an axiom because the problem remains unsolved—we assume the answer exists without proving it.

title: Lower Bound (Gyárfás-Lehel 1995)
content:
**gyarfas_lehel_lower_bound**: 1/2 < sSup {c | IsAdmissible c}.

The proof uses a **greedy algorithm**: repeatedly add elements that don't create sum collisions. In almost-Sidon sets, this produces Sidon subsets of size > n/2.

This improves the earlier Erdős-Sós bound of c ≥ 1/2.
mathContext: The greedy approach exploits the fact that few collisions exist locally.

title: Upper Bound (Gyárfás-Lehel 1995)
content:
**gyarfas_lehel_upper_bound**: sSup {c | IsAdmissible c} < 3/5.

The proof exhibits a **counterexample family**: the first n **Fibonacci numbers** form an almost-Sidon set whose largest Sidon subset has size just under 3n/5.

The Fibonacci structure creates specific difference patterns that limit Sidon subsets.
mathContext: Fibonacci numbers: 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, ... where F_{n+2} = F_{n+1} + F_n.

title: Difference Set Cardinality
content:
**sidon_difference_count**: A Sidon set of size n has |S - S| = n(n-1)/2 + n + 1.

**sidon_4_difference_count**: For n = 4, a Sidon set has |S - S| = 13.

A 4-element set has C(4,2) = 6 pairs. Each gives a distinct positive difference (and its negative), plus 0. So 12 non-zero values plus 0 = 13 total.

title: Basic Sidon Properties
content:
**sidon_subset**: Any subset of a Sidon set is Sidon.

**sidon_empty**: The empty set is Sidon (vacuously true).

**sidon_singleton**: Singletons {x} are Sidon (only x + x = 2x possible).

**sidon_pair**: Pairs {x, y} with x ≠ y are Sidon.

These provide base cases for inductive arguments.

title: Difference Set Properties
content:
**zero_mem_differenceSet**: For nonempty A, 0 ∈ A - A (since a - a = 0).

**differenceSet_symmetric**: x ∈ A - A ↔ -x ∈ A - A (since a - b = x implies b - a = -x).

These structural properties hold for any set, not just Sidon sets.

title: Bounds on |B - B| for 4-Sets
content:
**max_difference_4**: For any 4-element set B, |B - B| ≤ 13 (Sidon case is maximum).

**min_difference_4**: For any 4-element set B, |B - B| ≥ 7.

The minimum 7 occurs for **arithmetic progressions** {a, a+d, a+2d, a+3d}:
- Differences are 0, ±d, ±2d, ±3d (7 values)

So |B - B| ranges from 7 to 13 for 4-element sets.
mathContext: The condition |B - B| ≥ 11 excludes severely non-Sidon configurations.

title: Properties of Admissible Constants
content:
**zero_admissible**: c = 0 is admissible (empty set is Sidon, |∅| ≥ 0 · n).

**neg_admissible**: c < 0 is admissible (0 ≥ c · n for c < 0, n ≥ 0).

**admissible_bounded_above**: The set of admissible constants is bounded above (by 1, since |S| ≤ |A|).

**admissible_nonempty**: The set is nonempty (contains 0).

These ensure sSup exists by completeness of ℝ.

title: B₂ Sequences and Sidon Constant
content:
**IsB2Sequence**: A B₂ sequence is just a Sidon set (alternate terminology from additive combinatorics).

**sidon_constant**: Any finite set A ⊂ ℝ contains a Sidon subset of size ≥ C√|A| for some universal C > 0.

This is the general Sidon extraction problem. The almost-Sidon condition gives a *linear* guarantee instead of √n.
mathContext: The √n bound is optimal in general—some sets have no larger Sidon subsets.
